pull.title: ci: Use Cirrus "greedy" flag to use idle CPU time when available
pull.body: Disabled for MSan to avoid excessive RAM usage

events.body:
CI failure seems unrelated?

Aside from that, the CI durations seem to be much improved.

events.message:
ci: Use Cirrus "greedy" flag to use idle CPU time when available

MAKEJOBS limited for MSan to avoid excessive RAM usage

events.body: The rest of the tasks look ok, so limited that one to -j4 also
LGTM. This is hard to test, but easy to revert, so might be good to go.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -212,14 +213,14 @@ task:
     memory: 24G
   env:
     << : *CIRRUS_EPHEMERAL_WORKER_TEMPLATE_ENV
-    MAKEJOBS: "-j8"
     FILE_ENV: "./ci/test/00_setup_env_native_tsan.sh"
 
 task:
   name: '[MSan, depends] [focal]'
   << : *GLOBAL_TASK_TEMPLATE
   container:
     image: ubuntu:focal
+    greedy: false
comments.body: I think this can be removed. I was wrong yesterday to say that `greedy` can lead to OOM. It can not, since we always set the jobs with `MAKEJOBS`. So only `MAKEJOBS` can lead to OOM.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -212,14 +213,14 @@ task:
     memory: 24G
   env:
     << : *CIRRUS_EPHEMERAL_WORKER_TEMPLATE_ENV
-    MAKEJOBS: "-j8"
     FILE_ENV: "./ci/test/00_setup_env_native_tsan.sh"
 
 task:
   name: '[MSan, depends] [focal]'
   << : *GLOBAL_TASK_TEMPLATE
   container:
     image: ubuntu:focal
+    greedy: false
